thread.title: HAPPENING TODAY: Nagin appeal to be heard; temps a bit warmer
thread.title_full: HAPPENING TODAY: Nagin appeal to be heard; temps a bit warmer - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: HAPPENING TODAY: Nagin appeal to be heard; temps a bit warmer
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - Arguments in Ray Nagin appeal hearing to being Monday
A federal appeals court in New Orleans is scheduled to hear a challenge to Ray Nagin's corruption conviction. The former New Orleans mayor is serving a 10 year prison sentence for taking bribes from contractors seeking city work.
His appeal claims the judge gave the jury incorrect instructions which may have led to a different outcome.
In February of 2014, a jury found Nagin guilty on 20 of 21 counts of bribery, fraud and money laundering.
Franklin: More Sunshine expected for Monday
High temperatures today should run about 10 degrees warmer. Highs will return to the low and mid 80s this week as an upper ridge builds in.
By the weekend, a weak upper trough will send a cold front into the area. This should drop temperatures into the low 80s and low humidity is expected as well.
63rd Annual Red Mass
The Catholic Bishops of the State of Louisiana and the Saint Thomas More Catholic Lawyers’ Association will sponsor the 63rd Annual Red Mass,
Monday, October 5th at 9:30 AM at St. Louis Cathedral in New Orleans.
Archbishop Gregory Aymond will be the celebrant and Bishop Fernand “Ferd” J. Cheri will be the homilist. Members of the Louisiana State Judiciary will march robed in a walking procession, from the Louisiana Supreme Court, 400 Royal Street to the Cathedral. The procession will begin at 9:00 AM.
